text: Turon is a city in Reno County, Kansas, United States. In 2020, 309 people lived there. ==History== Turon was created in 1886. It was incorporated as a city in 1905. In 1887, the Chicago, Kansas and Nebraska Railway built a main line from Herington through Turon to Pratt. ==Geography== Turon is at (37.807415, -98.427061). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of . All of it is land. ===Weather=== Turon has hot, humid summers and generally mild to cool winters. The KÃ¶ppen Climate Classification system says that Turon has a humid subtropical climate, abbreviated "Cfa" on climate maps.Climate Summary for Turon, Kansas ==People== ===2020 census=== The 2020 census says that there were 309 people, 128 households, and 76 families living in Turon. Of the households, 79.7% owned their home and 20.3% rented their home. The median age was 38.5 years. Of the people, 75.1% were White, 1.3% were Native American, 6.5% were from some other race, and 17.2% were two or more races. Hispanic or Latino of any race were 16.8% of the people. ===2010 census=== The 2010 census says that there were 387 people, 159 households, and 98 families living in Turon. ==References== ==Other websites== ;City * Turon - Directory of Public Officials ;Schools * USD 310, local school district ;Maps * Turon City Map , KDOT Category:Cities in Reno County, Kansas Category:1886 establishments in Kansas
title: Turon, Kansas
